    Transforms 2 optionals into a) a new non-empty optional, if both are nonempty b) Optional.empty otherwise Throws if exactly 1 of the 2 are empty.

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • transformOptional

      public static <A,​ B> java.util.Optional<B> transformOptional​(java.util.Optional<A> optionalA, java.util.function.Function<A,​B> transformer)
      Transforms an Optional<A> into an Optional<B>, or keeps it empty. This is identical to the standard java Optional#map, except that it assumes the result of the transformer is not null by using Optional.of, whereas #map uses Optional.ofNullable. Also, this syntax is a bit more explicit; #map needs a little more context because it may get confused for the stream map method.

    • transformOptionalInt

      public static <T> java.util.Optional<T> transformOptionalInt​(java.util.OptionalInt optionalA, java.util.function.IntFunction<T> transformer)

    • transformOptionalLong

      public static <T> java.util.Optional<T> transformOptionalLong​(java.util.OptionalLong optionalA, java.util.function.LongFunction<T> transformer)

    • transformOptionalDouble

      public static <T> java.util.Optional<T> transformOptionalDouble​(java.util.OptionalDouble optionalA, java.util.function.DoubleFunction<T> transformer)

    • transformOptionalPreciseValueToOptionalDouble

      public static <T extends PreciseValue<T>> java.util.OptionalDouble transformOptionalPreciseValueToOptionalDouble​(java.util.Optional<T> optional)
      Just like transformOptional, but for the special case of converting an optional PreciseValue to a double optional.

    • transformOptionalImpreciseValueToOptionalDouble

      public static <T extends ImpreciseValue<T>> java.util.OptionalDouble transformOptionalImpreciseValueToOptionalDouble​(java.util.Optional<T> optional)
      Just like transformOptional, but for the special case of converting an optional ImpreciseValue to a double optional.

    • transformOptional2

      public static <A,​ B> java.util.Optional<B> transformOptional2​(java.util.Optional<A> optionalA, java.util.function.Function<A,​java.util.Optional<B>> transformer)
      This is a horrible name, but I can't think of a succinct name which also makes this look related to transformOptional. Similar to transformOptional, except that the transformer method returns an Optional<B>, not B.

    • transformPairOfOptionals

      public static <A,​ B,​ C> java.util.Optional<C> transformPairOfOptionals​(java.util.Optional<A> optionalA, java.util.Optional<B> optionalB, java.util.function.BiFunction<A,​B,​C> transformer)
      Transforms 2 optionals into a) a new non-empty optional, if both are nonempty b) Optional.empty otherwise
      See Also:
      (there is 1 overload)

    • transformPairOfOptionalsAssumingBothOrNeitherAreEmpty

      public static <A,​ B,​ C> java.util.Optional<C> transformPairOfOptionalsAssumingBothOrNeitherAreEmpty​(java.util.Optional<A> optionalA, java.util.Optional<B> optionalB, java.util.function.BiFunction<A,​B,​C> bothPresent)
      Transforms 2 optionals into a) a new non-empty optional, if both are nonempty b) Optional.empty otherwise Throws if exactly 1 of the 2 are empty.

    • transformPairOfOptionals

      public static <A,​ B,​ C> java.util.Optional<C> transformPairOfOptionals​(java.util.Optional<A> optionalA, java.util.Optional<B> optionalB, java.util.function.BiFunction<A,​B,​C> bothPresent, java.util.function.Function<A,​C> onlyAPresent, java.util.function.Function<B,​C> onlyBPresent)
      Transforms 2 optionals into a) a new non-empty optional, if either one is nonempty b) Optional.empty otherwise
      See Also:
      (there is 1 overload)

    • transformPairOfOptionals

      public static <A,​ B,​ C> C transformPairOfOptionals​(java.util.Optional<A> optionalA, java.util.Optional<B> optionalB, java.util.function.BiFunction<A,​B,​C> bothPresent, java.util.function.Function<A,​C> onlyAPresent, java.util.function.Function<B,​C> onlyBPresent, java.util.function.Supplier<C> neitherPresent)
      This is the most general case. It lets us handle the 4 cases of 2 optionals being empty/non-empty by using a visitor, which removes the need to have a bunch of if statements.

    • transformPairOfOptionalDoubles

      public static <T> T transformPairOfOptionalDoubles​(java.util.OptionalDouble optionalA, java.util.OptionalDouble optionalB, java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.Double,​java.lang.Double,​T> bothPresent, java.util.function.DoubleFunction<T> onlyAPresent, java.util.function.DoubleFunction<T> onlyBPresent, java.util.function.Supplier<T> neitherPresent)
      This is the most general case. It lets us handle the 4 cases of 2 optionals being empty/non-empty by using a visitor, which removes the need to have a bunch of if statements.

    • transformPairOfOptionalInts

      public static <T> T transformPairOfOptionalInts​(java.util.OptionalInt optionalA, java.util.OptionalInt optionalB, java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer,​T> bothPresent, java.util.function.IntFunction<T> onlyAPresent, java.util.function.IntFunction<T> onlyBPresent, java.util.function.Supplier<T> neitherPresent)
      This is the most general case. It lets us handle the 4 cases of 2 optionals being empty/non-empty by using a visitor, which removes the need to have a bunch of if statements.

      public static java.util.OptionalDouble transformPairOfOptionalDoubles​(java.util.OptionalDouble optionalA, java.util.OptionalDouble optionalB, java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.Double,​java.lang.Double,​java.lang.Double> transformer)

    • transformOptionalWithPredicate

      public static <T> java.util.Optional<T> transformOptionalWithPredicate​(java.util.Optional<T> optional, java.util.function.Predicate<T> predicate)
      For a non-empty optional, it will return it if it passes the predicate. Otherwise it will return empty. For an empty optional, it will return Optional.empty().

    • transformAtLeastOnePresentOptionalOrThrow

      public static <T> T transformAtLeastOnePresentOptionalOrThrow​(java.util.Optional<T> optional1, java.util.Optional<T> optional2, java.util.function.BinaryOperator<T> whenBothPresent)
      When exactly one of the two optionals is present, returns its value (unwrapped from the optional). When both are present, returns a transformed value. When neither is present, throws.

    • transformAtLeastOnePresentOptionalOrThrow

      public static <T> T transformAtLeastOnePresentOptionalOrThrow​(java.util.Optional<T> optional1, java.util.Optional<T> optional2, java.util.function.BinaryOperator<T> whenBothPresent, java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.String> errorMessageWhenBothAbsent)

      Converts an OptionalInt to an Optional of Integer.

      Converts an OptionalLong to an Optional of Long.

      public static java.util.Optional<java.lang.Double> toNonSpecializedOptional​(java.util.OptionalDouble optionalDouble)
      Converts an OptionalDouble to an Optional of Double.
